content:
Hello, and welcomed to Friendworld! I'm so glad that you've decided to stop by and hang out at this corner of the internet!

If you're visiting for the first time, then you might notice that friendworld looks and feels a little different from other social networks... And that's 100% intentional! I built Friendworld because I was dissatisfied with the current state of affairs over at facebook, twitter, reddit, and instagram. I was tired of mindlessly wasting all of my time on websites built by giant multinational corporations to track me, categorize me, and sell me crap. I was tired of using websites and apps designed to keep me addicted to their platform with the same manipulative tactics used by slot machines. And most importantly, I was tired of sifting through an endless stream of low-quality content -- much of which bordered on propaganda!

Here at Friendworld, you don't have to worry about any of that. Even though it does have some ads (running servers ain't cheap!), selling you random crap and tracking you is not my prerogative. Friendworld is designed from the ground up to be about one thing and one thing only: creating a meaningful experience for the user. There aren't many places left on the internet where you can let loose, and not have to worry about your own content being used against you. And I wanted to fix that.

Rather than continuously attempting to trigger short bursts of dopamine with meaningless notifications, Friendworld's sleek and minimalistic UI puts a strong emphasis on fostering long-form discussion. Additionally, I've chosen to use state-of-the-art machine learning technology to help keep moderation fair and balanced, and to help nudge the conversation back on track. And most importantly, I promise to never track you, show you targeted ads, or collect and sell your personal data. I'll never "sell out" to corporate interests -- the only person I work for is you :)

So remember, whether you're in the middle of a heated discussion, creating an account for the first time, or just lurking, Friendworld is the place for you! Remember to be respectful of the other users, use common sense before you post, and to BE YOURSELF.

S

Cryptocurrencies are a very interesting way to store (and maybe even grow) your wealth, but they're not a very good long-term investment strategy, in my opinion. The basic idea is predicated upon the stability of the public internet. What happens when the powers-that-be decide to take away your access to the public internet? What happens in the event of a major global catastrophe with widespread infrastructural outages? Your cryptocurrencies won't help you in that case.

I'm of the opinion that "growing your wealth" is a fool's errand with respect to the current state of globalization and capitalism. Focus on your energies on cultivating useful skills -- like farming and basic medical care. If you find the need to hoard wealth, then buy a hefty supply of canned goods, warm clothes, firearms, and water-purification tablets.

Besides, I'm not sure I'd be comfortable handing over my money to some kook on the internet.

thread.title: John Cena: Member of the Illuminati??

content:
I'll tell you another fact that not many people know: In the early 80s, McMahon's modus operandi was to break out of the territory system of his father's generation and secure national (and eventually international) exposure. And he wildly succeeded in that mission. Why? Two reasons: First, he pulled some strings and got Mr Thunderlips himself, Terry Bollea (aka Hulk Hogan) a massive part in mega-blockbuster Rocky III; and Second, he pulled some more strings and landed major national broadcasting contracts.

If it sounds like McMahon had some help pulling these two stunts, then you're paying attention. He *did* have quite a bit of help. At the time, a consortium of boxing promotions, the newly merged NBA, NFL, MLB, and NHL had their own sites set on increased advertisement revenue. But they had a problem in their sagging ratings. Early 80s American television viewers were saturated in more media than any other group of humans throughout human history. Viewers might tune in occasionally throughout a sporting season, but why should they care? And these sporting execs soon realized that it was their titles. The drive for an entire season is for a team or individual to win the top prize of that league or promotion. But what's the value in that? Who cares about a title? What does the title mean? A title is just an arbitrary designation granted to an entity based on their mastery of an arbitrary set of rules. There was no intrinsic value. These titles, they realized, lacked a certain... luster. 

And so, the sporting execs turned to wrestling. They realized that professional wrestling titles, so clearly fake and artificial, provided the perfect counterpoint to the "real" and valuable trophies. As Baudrillard might say, they were able to point to the wrestling titles as fake such that they could point to their own titles as real. Similar to how adults can walk out of Disney World into the parking lot, and say to themselves: "Now THIS parking lot is a real place -- not like that completely artificial universe I just stepped out of."

Having come to this realization, the execs decided to pull their own strings and get McMahon what he wanted. Unsurprisingly, professional wrestling entered the biggest boom period of its industry's history, and the "real" sporting industry benefitted immensely from it.

thread.title: The "what are you doin right now" thread

content:
I was recently involved in a really bad bike accident. On top of several physical injuries, I've also been suffering from severe depression since it happened.

I keep thinking back to that night: As I ride through the street, hours after a rainstorm, I can feel the warm summer air, ionized and humid, hitting my skin. After biking for close to an hour, my mind is empty, and all I hear are the sounds of my tires gliding against wet pavement. When I glance to my left I see the occasional car. But this time, it makes a quick left turn. I have no time to react, but my body instinctually braces for impact. The car slams into the left side of my body, making first contact with my knee, and then my calf, thigh, and hip. As I'm flung onto the pavement my head smacks the ground, and I hear the sound of the car screeching off. Hit and fucking run.

There are a million reasons why this could lead to depression:
- I could have died. Or, at very least, I could have been severely concussed or paralyzed. I suppose I'm lucky that it wasn't worse, but coming that close to an absolute travesty is jarring.
- I didn't escape that easily, though. I at least suffered a minor concussion, possibly damaged the ligaments in me knee, and scraped up my face pretty bad. It wouldn't surprise me if I end up with some bad scarring.
- The pain is tolerable if I stay still, but it's still pretty bad. There's definitely some looming anxiety that it's something that I'll have to deal with for quite a while.
- I'm pretty much immobilized. I can't leave my apartment and can't go outside and exercise during the nicest weather in months. This has also lead to social isolation. The timing of all of this is pretty unfortunate, as I just ended a long-term romantic relationship, and the way I'd usually deal with being down in the dumps is by exercising and spending time with my friends.
- I don't even want to talk about the financial strain this is putting on me. I'm lost in a sea of red tape and medical bills. My insurance is looking for any possible way to screw me over, and my wallet is going to take a pretty big hit. Aside from the financial stress, it's pretty dehumanizing when you're physical health is reduced to mere paperwork.
- The fact that someone would flee the scene without so much as checking to see if I was okay has really caused me to lose faith in humanity. it just goes to show that there are some real scum bags out there, and you can only rely on yourself. More broadly, It's really forced me to think about how fucked up our society needs to be to create the incentives for someone to do something like that. Evidently, no one had any incentive to help me up, or call 911, or even ask if I was okay.

But none of these are reasons why I'm depressed. After many days of introspection and countless hours of research I realized the truth:

My accident rekindled a traumatic past-life experience.

I know this might sound strange (and I even decided to make this post under a throwaway account to avoid ridicule), but it's the truth. Late last night a memory that I've never experience before -- and possibly even repressed -- was triggered after I replayed the accident in my head. I was a hunter gatherer, walking through the woods by moonlight. My wife and children were back at camp with the rest of my tribe, enjoying the summer night, laughing and singing songs. I don't know why I choose to be away from them, but I enjoyed the solitude. Being somewhat hungry, I decided to climb a tree and see if I could find some fruit. I climbed that tree, still slippery from a rainstorm hours earlier. Then I saw the black bear. It scared the hell out of me, causing my to slip and lose my balance. I fell out of the tree, and the left side of my body made impact with the ground and my head cracking against a rock. I tried crawling to safety, but didn't get very far. I died in the forest that night. At least, that version of me died.

Once I emerged from this memory, it all seemed to make sense. None of my other problems went away, but once I realized that my depression was really cause by past-life trauma, it felt like a tremendous weight was lifted from my shoulders.

Anyhow, I've been engaging with several past-life therapists, and they all suggested that writing this all out and sharing it in public would provide me with some catharsis -- and they were right. I'm still a little scared of ridicule by my friends and family, so I made a throwaway account for this post. But from what I've seen of the community here so far, I'm very optimistic :)

I wasn't a believer before this, but now I am. Past-life therapy is the REAL DEAL.

content:
Hi Tom, I know that you're going through a lot of stress right now. But believe me-- I've been there. In fact, this sort of thing is MUCH more common than you'd expect. In any given year, various Deep State agencies of the Federal Government keep close tabs on at least 500,000 people-- many of whom are citizens, although some are just interesting illegal aliens. A smaller subset of this group-- maybe 25,000 of them-- are subjected to a much more focused surveillance program. Most of the TI community falls into this bucket (the rest are just crazy, believe it or not, but thats a different story). It sounds like you fall into this latter group. The most important thing to remember is to KEEP CALM. If they know that you know about them, they will become much more aggressive, and try to eliminate you before you have a chance to tell others. Its obviously too late for that, but you can still take some actions to mitigate the damage:

First, be sure to use VPNs and throwaway accounts/emails in all of your online communication. Similarly, be sure to avoid giving out identifying information. If they cant tell that you are you, then they cant know what you know. Also, use an anonymous browser like tor, and DELETE YOUR BROWSING HISTORY. If you're doing this already then things are less urgent, but you should still read through these instructions to be safe.

Second, theres a good chance that you've already been chipped, so you're going to need to run some tests. The best way to tell is by using magnets. The ones sitting on your refrigerator wont do. You'll need something a bit stronger. If you don't happen to have a strong magnet lying around the house, go pick one up at the hardware store. But don't be too conspicuous. Buy a hammer, some nails, duct tape, and a box cutter as long as you're there. It will look like you're doing some basic home improvement, and won't raise any eyebrows. Besides, you'll need all of these later. Remember to pay for all of this in CASH, or possibly an anonymous cryptocurrency. You don't want them tracking your purchases. Once you're home, you're going to want to use the magnet to check for implants. In particular, you're going to want to check your temples, hands, and neck-- but really anywhere on your head could be affected. Also check the fleshier parts of you're body, such as your biceps or buttocks. if you feel a magnetic tug, I hate to tell you: but you're going to have to use the box cutter and some tweezers to pull it out. Be sure to sterilize the blade first with some rubbing alcohol.

Third, once you're clean-- and depending on the severity of your situation-- you might want to consider physically escaping your current life. Don't tell anyone-- you don't know who you can trust, so it's best to just GET OUT. I have some more thoughts on this, but it's best to not discuss in public. If you'd like some help, I'm happy to coordinate over Direct Message.

And remember, try to act sooner rather than later. The cat is very likely already out of the bag, so to speak, so you at least need some damage control ASAP. Good luck.

So, a few days ago I took @BullseyeBob's advice and gave my body a sweep for tracking chips -- and boy, am I glad I did! I was completely shocked to find that I had a big fat one implanted in the back of my neck where it connects to the base of my skull. Thankfully I was able to cut it out. It wasn't easy, but im glad I did it. My thoughts have been so much clearer, and I've even had more energy. 

Don't get me wrong, I wasn't feeling great after I first extracted it. It hurt like nothing else, and I felt fairly dizzy/nauseous for a couple days, but that eventually passed.

I don't know what the chip was doing, exactly, but I suspect that it created some sort of symbiotic relationship with my mind. There was at least some sort of feedback loop going on, because after extraction it felt like a part of my brain was missing. I noticed that over the past several months I had been falling into certain thought patterns, which were reinforced by the chip. Here's an example: before, I would get hungry and an electrical signal in my brain would tell me to order food on the internet. This was clearly the desired reaction of whoever chipped me, as it gave them a clear paper trail of what I ate. I'm sure that every meal I ate in the last couple months was logged to a database somewhere. But after extraction, I noticed that after I got hungry I'd forget what I was doing. Without that feedback loop telling me what to do, my thought patterns no longer made any sense. It took a little while to adjust, but I'm starting to feel better. There's definitely a retraining process that needs to take place, to say the least. At the end of the day though, I think it will be worth it.

All in all, I feel focused, energized, and excited. It's a brand new me!

thread.title: Why isn't anyone talking about this Chinese Drone Swarm??!

content:
Oh, believe me, @hubert, Chinese officials are reading every word you say-- on or off friendworld. In fact, I can tell you with a high degree of certainty that several accounts on friendworld are controlled indirectly by the Chinese government. 

But to preemptively answer your concerns, that doesn't necessarily mean that we should give up *all* forms of public communication. There are two reasons for this. First, there is no practical alternative to educating new members of the community. Furthermore, not only is all of this information already known by prying eyes, but they also already know that we know! And this touches on the second point: posting things in public forums gives us the chance to shape the narrative. It gives us a chance to shape their understanding of us. This means that it is often beneficial for us to occasionally (or frequently, if the situation calls for it) throw deliberate falsehoods into our public correspondence. On one hand, it can throw them off the scent. On the other hand, it will likely fly well over the head of the ignorant reader... if phrased properly. 

In any case, I encourage you to USE PRIVATE MODES OF COMMUNICATION for exchanging sensitive information. And even then, it can often times be hard to make sure that They aren't meddling-- or even that you can trust your counterparty. 

All in all, be wary of what you say, and to whom. But don't sweat the small stuff.

content:
I just went through hell last night. I came home from work around 11, like I usually do, and my door was wide open. I walked in, and the place was a disaster. Broken glass everywhere, my stereo missing, food and books and such strewn across the floor... and most importantly, all my important documents were missing. Gone. What a mess.

I didn't know what to do, so I just sat there in shock for a few minutes. Aside from the destructions to my possessions, it just felt like such an invasion of privacy. But then things got so much worse. I noticed that my computer was still there. Any sense of relief I felt in that moment was completely overtaken by horror once I looked at the screen. There was a video on there of two men in ski masks walking around my apartment at night while I was sleeping! And it wasn't just one clip; I saw footage that couldn't have been less than three years old. I've been living like this for so long and had no idea. They left a note open on my text editor: "Thanks for the memories".

It looked like that was all filmed from the top left corner of my living room, no doubt some tiny camera poking out of the wall, and connected to a raspberry pi or something. The thing I don't understand is how they connected to my wifi without me knowing. Im usually VERY diligent in guarding against unwanted connections. Or, at least I thought. But of course, they also took my router, so I don't think I can do much debugging on the problem. 

Anyhow, the  things got even weirder. I went downstairs to have a cigarette, and couldn't have been gone more than 10 minutes. I went back upstairs, and there was a team of maybe six Hispanic men and women cleaning my apartment! So I started yelling at them to stop because they were wiping away all of the evidence. I don't think they understood me because they kept going for a few more minutes until I was screaming as loud as I could. And if things couldn't get any worse, they tried to charge me $300! Needless to say, they was no way I was going to give them $300.  

Unfortunately, the clean up team probably wiped away any trail of the original perps, and the video on my laptop got corrupted. Now there's no hard evidence left, and I'm afraid that if I went to the police the perps would blackmail me.

I just feel so violated from the whole experience and am not sure what to do. I thought this period of my life was over, but I guess I was wrong. content:
I started baking bread for fun early last year when my father gave me a sourdough starter. At first I did it to relieve stress. I had a lot going on in my life, and I found it very soothing to be in the kitchen needing dough in silence at 1am. It was something I looked forward to every week, as it allowed me to tune out and be alone with my thoughts for a couple hours -- something I didn't get much of a chance to do.

Then I missed a week. I think it was just pure negligence on my part, and I was sort of bummed out, but I didn't think much of it. Then a couple days later I woke up at 4am to what I thought was someone saying "It's time to make bread." It scared the hell out of me at first, but I didn't see anyone when I looked around the room, so I just shrugged it off. I figured it was just my anxiety getting to me. I went back to sleep, made some more bread that week, and forgot about the incident.

Then I missed another week. A few days later I was walking to work when I heard the same voice: "Make your bread!" -- but when I turned around there was no one behind me! This really freaked me out. I figured maybe a stranger yelled it at me or something, but how would any of them know I bake bread? And even if they did, why would they care what I did in my free time? But again, I shrugged it off. I thought I was just imagining things. There w as no other logical explanation for it.

A couple months later I missed another week. I was riding the subway when I heard the same voice! "Where's the bread?" I was pretty freaked out, but the subway car was packed so I tried to ignore it. But then maybe 30 seconds later, the voice says: "You didn't make any bread this week." I looked around again, but everyone was just standing there on their phones, sucked into their commuting routine. "I didn't have any time this week," I mumbled under my breath. "Then maybe you should MAKE time," it replied. This really took my aback, but again, I was on the subway and didn't want to freak people out, so I tried to stay cool. I mumbled back "Okay, I think I'll have some time this week". The voice didn't respond, and I made a couple loaves at the end of the week.

This has been going on for months now, and it's starting to drive me crazy. Now the voice seems to check in with me every Wednesday and Sunday, regardless of whether I bake bread or not. but it's worse when I don't so I've been baking multiple times a week. Last night it wouldn't leave me alone until I made NINE FUCKING LOAFS! That's a lot of bread! I don't even know what to do with it. I can't eat that much bread, and the voice is just going to have me make more in a couple days.

This whole thing is really exhausting, and is starting to get out of hand. I don't even like baking bread any more, to be honest. All the joy is gone, and it's just becoming another rote task. It feels like all I ever do is bake bread or prepare to bake bread. Not to mention, buying all this flour is costing me a fortune. This is turning into a very expensive "hobby".

So does anyone know how to make the voice stop? And if not, does anyone have any good sour dough recipes they can share? I'm getting really fucking sick of making the same recipes over and over again. It would be nice if I could at least switch it up a bit.

content:
@BreadBoy -- I think you'll be glad to know that you're NOT CRAZY. This sounds like a classic example of falling victim to malicious use of v2k (voice to skull) technology. If I had to wager a guess, I'd say that you've either made some powerful enemies in the last year and a half, or you happen to fall into a very specific demographic/psychographic. I've heard through some back channels (of which I'm not at liberty to discuss) that there's been an uptick in hyper targeted v2k advertisements over the last year-- and it seems that you might be one of such targets.

If this is the case, you don't have much to worry about. You can safely stop making bread whenever you'd like. The bread industry has sunk quite a bit of money into this project, so they've likely seen their revenue increase quite a bit. Therefore, it's highly unlikely that they'll care much about what you do. They are at the point where the variable cost of each message is so low that they have automated the whole process. Even if they cared to hurt you, it would cost them more than you're worth.

Now, you must be wondering how to stop the voices. There are two options, neither of which are great, but they will certainly solve your problem. One, you can purchase a v2k auditory jammer. I haven't kept up with the space very much, so I can't make any specific recommendations. A good friend of mine says that there's an MIT graduate who has made several youtube videos on the subject, so I'd encourage you to look for those. This will stop the voices for the time being, but keep in mind that as their technology advances, your jammer might become obsolete.

Second, you can relocate from whichever city you currently live in to a more rural area. It costs a lot fo money to set up the proper infrastructure to send out mass v2k messages, so if you move to a less dense area, you are likely in the clear. At that point, the infrastructural investment to target you would cost them more than you're worth. Of course, the technology will advance enough over the next 10 years such that you will eventually be "in range", so to speak, but by then there should be other means for dealing with this problem.

I see all the cameras. They're in every store front, they're in people's phones, they're even on traffic lights. thread.title: Have you had any good dreams recently?

content:
I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed: “We hold these truths to be self-evident: that all men are created equal.”

I have a dream that one day on the red hills of Georgia the sons of former slaves and the sons of former slave owners will be able to sit down together at the table of brotherhood.

I have a dream that one day even the state of Mississippi, a state sweltering with the heat of injustice, sweltering with the heat of oppression, will be transformed into an oasis of freedom and justice.

I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character.

I have a dream today.

I have a dream that one day, down in Alabama, with its vicious racists, with its governor having his lips dripping with the words of interposition and nullification; one day right there in Alabama, little black boys and black girls will be able to join hands with little white boys and white girls as sisters and brothers.

I have a dream today.

I have a dream that one day every valley shall be exalted, every hill and mountain shall be made low, the rough places will be made plain, and the crooked places will be made straight, and the glory of the Lord shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together.

This is our hope. This is the faith that I go back to the South with. With this faith we will be able to hew out of the mountain of despair a stone of hope. With this faith we will be able to transform the jangling discords of our nation into a beautiful symphony of brotherhood. With this faith we will be able to work together, to pray together, to struggle together, to go to jail together, to stand up for freedom together, knowing that we will be free one day.

This will be the day when all of God’s children will be able to sing with a new meaning, “My country, ‘tis of thee, sweet land of liberty, of thee I sing. Land where my fathers died, land of the pilgrim’s pride, from every mountainside, let freedom ring.”

And if America is to be a great nation this must become true. So let freedom ring from the prodigious hilltops of New Hampshire. Let freedom ring from the mighty mountains of New York. Let freedom ring from the heightening Alleghenies of Pennsylvania!

Let freedom ring from the snowcapped Rockies of Colorado!

Let freedom ring from the curvaceous slopes of California!

But not only that; let freedom ring from Stone Mountain of Georgia!

Let freedom ring from Lookout Mountain of Tennessee!

Let freedom ring from every hill and molehill of Mississippi. From every mountainside, let freedom ring.

And when this happens, when we allow freedom to ring, when we let it ring from every village and every hamlet, from every state and every city, we will be able to speed up that day when all of God’s children, black men and white men, Jews and Gentiles, Protestants and Catholics, will be able to join hands and sing in the words of the old Negro spiritual, “Free at last! free at last! thank God Almighty, we are free at last!”
